title: BOJ Received No Bids From Financial Firms at Fixed-Rate Operation
sub_head: The yield on the 10-year JGB is at 0.205% currently
body:
The Bank of Japan on Monday received no bids from financial companies at its operation to buy recently issued 10-year Japanese government bonds at a fixed rate of 0.25%.
On Thursday, the BOJ said it plans to offer a fixed-rate operation Monday morning, after the yield on the 10-year JGB hit 0.23%. The 10-year government bond yield can fluctuate up to a quarter percentage point above or below the zero target, according to the central bankâ€™s latest guidance.
